refnamediv.refpurpose: max Selects the maximum value for the specified attribute, optionally over one or more dimensions.

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The max operator calculates the maximum of the specified attribute in the array. Result is an array with single element containing the maximum of the specified attribute. For the corresponding aggregate, see the max aggregate reference.

refsect1.title: Inputs
refsect1.para:
The max operator takes the following arguments:
array: a source array with one or more attributes and one or more dimensions.
attribute: an optional attribute. If no attribute is provided, the first attribute in the source array is used.
dimension_n: An optional list of dimensions to group by.

informalexample.para: This example find the maximum value of each row of a 2-dimensional array.

step.para: Create a 1-attribute, 2-dimensional array called m3x3:--afl CREATE ARRAY m3x3 <val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0]; --show-output=no
Store values of 0â€“8 in m3x3:--afl store(build(m3x3,i*3+j),m3x3); --output-format=dense --chunkify=yes
Select the maximum value of each row of m3x3:--afl max(m3x3,val,i); --output-format=dense
